meanings.definition: The action of transferring something or someone from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transferences of goods from the warehouse to the store were done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The transferences of patients from one hospital to another require careful coordination.
meanings.sent3: The transferences of snacks from the pantry to my room always mysteriously disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her transferences of knowledge to her students were like planting seeds in a garden.
meanings.sent5: The transferences of power between the two rival groups were tense and dramatic.

meanings.definition: The process of moving something from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: The transferences of books from the library to my friend were helpful.
meanings.sent2: The transferences of responsibilities from one team member to another were smooth.
meanings.sent3: The transferences of jokes from one friend to another kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His transferences of ideas to his colleagues sparked creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The transferences of emotions from the character to the audience were palpable.

meanings.definition: The act of projecting one's feelings or emotions onto another person.
meanings.sent1: Her transferences of happiness onto her friends made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: The transferences of fear onto the group created a sense of unease.
meanings.sent3: The transferences of excitement onto the team before the game were contagious.
meanings.sent4: His transferences of anger onto his brother caused a heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The transferences of love onto the canvas brought the painting to life.
